definition: eyes bright and full of expression

sentences.english: She gave him, straight in the eyes, a look which was also inscrutable.
sentences.chinese: 她还目光炯炯地注视了他一下，这也使他不能理解。

sentences.english: He is an elderly gentleman, silver-haired, with a twinkle in his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位上了年纪的绅士，满头银发，两眼炯炯有神。

sentences.english: Great reed hear me out after Muguangjiongjiong looked at me.
sentences.chinese: 大苇听我说完后目光炯炯看着我。

sentences.english: Dead place with light, and life, and vernal air.
sentences.chinese: 充满生命的活力和炯炯光明。

sentences.english: She has the same rich, full, dark eyes, with its long lashes.
sentences.chinese: 她有一双同样炯炯有光，滚圆而乌黑的眼睛，上面。

sentences.english: Her eyes had remain young and vivacious .
sentences.chinese: 她的眼睛非常年轻，炯炯有神。

sentences.english: His chest swelled proudly, his eyes glowed.
sentences.chinese: 他的胸膛傲然挺起，目光炯炯。

sentences.english: He must remain sober-minded, bright and piercing eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他必须头脑清醒，目光炯炯有神。

sentences.english: The little girl began to read the petition.
sentences.chinese: 她读了不一会儿，眼神炯炯有光，呼吸急速。

sentences.english: He was a youny man, bright of eye and quick of movement.
sentences.chinese: 他是个青年人，目光炯炯有神，行动敏捷。

sentences.english: You had a black eye. A right bloody shiner.
sentences.chinese: 你有一双黑色的眼睛，炯炯有神。

sentences.english: He has a pair of bright piercing eyes.

definition: eyes bright and full of expression
to look at from close up/to watch intently
